Description: Body and foot of an Attic red-figured pottery squat lekythos; neck, handle and mouth missing, Black glazed with palmette in front.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Found together in one tomb with Boston MFA P.5715 (=11.46019), P.5717 (=88.819) and P.5718 (=RES.87.163).
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 237, no. 234)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1955)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5716 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
